EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.98}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Safety on the y-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Safety on the y-axis is {0.64}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Road on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Road on the x-axis is {0.68}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Intermodal and Cost or the cell corresponding to Tracking and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Tracking} and {Technology} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Maritime and Cost or the cell corresponding to Pipeline and Speed?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Pipeline} and {Speed} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Customs and Compliance or the cell corresponding to Customs and Sustainability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Customs} and {Sustainability} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.71 to 0.87?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Pipeline, Efficiency), (Rail, Efficiency), (Road, Efficiency), (Pipeline, Safety), (Tracking, Safety), (Tracking, Speed), (Pipeline, Sustainability), (Tracking, Sustainability), (Rail, Technology), (Road, Technology)}.
